Browse the source code of netbsd/external/ibm-public/postfix/dist/src/postkick/postkick.c

1/* $NetBSD: postkick.c,v 1.2 2017/02/14 01:16:46 christos Exp $ */
2
3/*++
4/* NAME
5/* postkick 1
6/* SUMMARY
7/* kick a Postfix service
8/* SYNOPSIS
9/* .fi
10/* \fBpostkick\fR [\fB-c \fIconfig_dir\fR] [\fB-v\fR]
11/* \fIclass service request\fR
12/* DESCRIPTION
13/* The \fBpostkick\fR(1) command sends \fIrequest\fR to the
14/* specified \fIservice\fR over a local transport channel.
15/* This command makes Postfix private IPC accessible
16/* for use in, for example, shell scripts.
17/*
18/* Options:
19/* .IP "\fB-c\fR \fIconfig_dir\fR"
20/* Read the \fBmain.cf\fR configuration file in the named directory
21/* instead of the default configuration directory.
22/* .IP \fB-v\fR
23/* Enable verbose logging for debugging purposes. Multiple \fB-v\fR
24/* options make the software increasingly verbose.
25/* .PP
26/* Arguments:
27/* .IP \fIclass\fR
28/* Name of a class of local transport channel endpoints,
29/* either \fBpublic\fR (accessible by any local user) or
30/* \fBprivate\fR (administrative access only).
31/* .IP \fIservice\fR
32/* The name of a local transport endpoint within the named class.
33/* .IP \fIrequest\fR
34/* A string. The list of valid requests is service-specific.
35/* DIAGNOSTICS
36/* Problems and transactions are logged to the standard error
37/* stream.
38/* ENVIRONMENT
39/* .ad
40/* .fi
41/* .IP \fBMAIL_CONFIG\fR
42/* Directory with Postfix configuration files.
43/* .IP \fBMAIL_VERBOSE\fR
44/* Enable verbose logging for debugging purposes.
45/* CONFIGURATION PARAMETERS
46/* .ad
47/* .fi
48/* The following \fBmain.cf\fR parameters are especially relevant to
49/* this program.
50/* The text below provides only a parameter summary. See
51/* \fBpostconf\fR(5) for more details including examples.
52/* .IP "\fBconfig_directory (see 'postconf -d' output)\fR"
53/* The default location of the Postfix main.cf and master.cf
54/* configuration files.
55/* .IP "\fBapplication_event_drain_time (100s)\fR"
56/* How long the \fBpostkick\fR(1) command waits for a request to enter the
57/* Postfix daemon process input buffer before giving up.
58/* .IP "\fBqueue_directory (see 'postconf -d' output)\fR"
59/* The location of the Postfix top-level queue directory.
60/* FILES
61/* /var/spool/postfix/private, private class endpoints
62/* /var/spool/postfix/public, public class endpoints
63/* SEE ALSO
64/* qmgr(8), queue manager trigger protocol
65/* pickup(8), local pickup daemon
66/* postconf(5), configuration parameters
67/* LICENSE
68/* .ad
69/* .fi
70/* The Secure Mailer license must be distributed with this software.
71/* AUTHOR(S)
72/* Wietse Venema
73/* IBM T.J. Watson Research
74/* P.O. Box 704
75/* Yorktown Heights, NY 10598, USA
76/*
77/* Wietse Venema
78/* Google, Inc.
79/* 111 8th Avenue
80/* New York, NY 10011, USA
81/*--*/
82
83/* System library. */
84
85#include <sys_defs.h>
86#include <sys/stat.h>
87#include <fcntl.h>
88#include <unistd.h>
89#include <syslog.h>
90#include <string.h>
91#include <stdlib.h>
92
93/* Utility library. */
94
95#include <msg.h>
96#include <mymalloc.h>
97#include <vstream.h>
98#include <msg_vstream.h>
99#include <safe.h>
100#include <events.h>
101#include <warn_stat.h>
102
103/* Global library. */
104
105#include <mail_proto.h>
106#include <mail_params.h>
107#include <mail_version.h>
108#include <mail_conf.h>
109
110static NORETURN usage(char *myname)
111{
112 msg_fatal("usage: %s [-c config_dir] [-v] class service request", myname);
113}
114
115MAIL_VERSION_STAMP_DECLARE;
116
117int main(int argc, char **argv)
118{
119 char *class;
120 char *service;
121 char *request;
122 int fd;
123 struct stat st;
124 char *slash;
125 int c;
126
127 /*
128 * Fingerprint executables and core dumps.
129 */
130 MAIL_VERSION_STAMP_ALLOCATE;
131
132 /*
133 * To minimize confusion, make sure that the standard file descriptors
134 * are open before opening anything else. XXX Work around for 44BSD where
135 * fstat can return EBADF on an open file descriptor.
136 */
137 for (fd = 0; fd < 3; fd++)
138 if (fstat(fd, &st) == -1
139 && (close(fd), open("/dev/null", O_RDWR, 0)) != fd)
140 msg_fatal("open /dev/null: %m");
141
142 /*
143 * Process environment options as early as we can.
144 */
145 if (safe_getenv(CONF_ENV_VERB))
146 msg_verbose = 1;
147
148 /*
149 * Initialize. Set up logging, read the global configuration file and
150 * extract configuration information.
151 */
152 if ((slash = strrchr(argv[0], '/')) != 0 && slash[1])
153 argv[0] = slash + 1;
154 msg_vstream_init(argv[0], VSTREAM_ERR);
155 set_mail_conf_str(VAR_PROCNAME, var_procname = mystrdup(argv[0]));
156
157 /*
158 * Parse JCL.
159 */
160 while ((c = GETOPT(argc, argv, "c:v")) > 0) {
161 switch (c) {
162 default:
163 usage(argv[0]);
164 case 'c':
165 if (setenv(CONF_ENV_PATH, optarg, 1) < 0)
166 msg_fatal("out of memory");
167 break;
168 case 'v':
169 msg_verbose++;
170 break;
171 }
172 }
173 if (argc != optind + 3)
174 usage(argv[0]);
175 class = argv[optind];
176 service = argv[optind + 1];
177 request = argv[optind + 2];
178
179 /*
180 * Finish initializations.
181 */
182 mail_conf_read();
183 if (chdir(var_queue_dir))
184 msg_fatal("chdir %s: %m", var_queue_dir);
185
186 /*
187 * Kick the service.
188 */
189 if (mail_trigger(class, service, request, strlen(request)) < 0) {
190 msg_warn("Cannot contact class %s service %s - perhaps the mail system is down",
191 class, service);
192 exit(1);
193 }
194
195 /*
196 * Problem: With triggers over full duplex (i.e. non-FIFO) channels, we
197 * must avoid closing the channel before the server has received the
198 * request. Otherwise some hostile kernel may throw away the request.
199 *
200 * Solution: The trigger routine registers a read event handler that runs
201 * when the server closes the channel. The event_drain() routine waits
202 * for the event handler to run, but gives up when it takes too long.
203 */
204 else {
205 event_drain(var_event_drain);
206 exit(0);
207 }
208}
209
